entities.name: professor mcgonagall
entities.description: Professor McGonagall is introduced as a character who has an opinion and is reacting to Umbridge's statement. She is described as having 'eyes flew open' which suggests she is surprised or upset.

entities.name: dolores
entities.description: Dolores is introduced as Professor McGonagall's house, suggesting it is a place of importance to her. It is mentioned in the context of 'what I think that counts, as they are in my House'.

entities.name: umbridge
entities.description: Umbridge is introduced as a character who has an opinion and is contradicting Professor McGonagall. She is described as 'simpered' which suggests she is being insincere or trying to manipulate others.

entities.name: cornelius
entities.description: Cornelius is mentioned as someone who has sent something to Umbridge, but his role in the story is not clear. He may be a minor character or a person of importance.

entities.name: minerva
entities.description: Minerva is Professor McGonagall's given name, suggesting that she is a complex character with multiple identities. It is mentioned in the context of Umbridge addressing her.

entities.name: the minister
entities.description: The Minister is mentioned as someone who has sent something to Umbridge, but their role in the story is not clear. They may be a minor character or a person of importance.

relationships.description: Professor McGonagall is described as having 'my House, Dolores' which suggests that she owns or has control over the house.
Umbridge receives something from Cornelius, suggesting a relationship of recipient and sender.
The Minister sends something to Umbridge, suggesting a relationship of sender and recipient.
